edu.illinois.library.cantaloupe.processor

Interface Processor

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    FileProcessor, StreamProcessor

    public interface Processor

    Abstract image processor interface.

    Implementations must implement FileProcessor and/or StreamProcessor and can assume that their source will be set (via FileProcessor.setSourceFile(java.io.File) or StreamProcessor.setStreamSource(edu.illinois.library.cantaloupe.resolver.StreamSource)) before any other methods are called.

      • process

        void process(OperationList ops,
             ImageInfo sourceInfo,
             java.io.OutputStream outputStream)
      throws ProcessorException

        Performs the supplied operations on an image, reading it from the supplied stream, and writing the result to the supplied stream.

        Operations should be applied in the order they appear in the OperationList iterator. For the sake of efficiency, implementations should check whether each one is a no-op (Operation.isNoOp()) before performing it.

        Implementations should get the full size of the source image from the sourceSize parameter instead of their {#link #getSize} method, for efficiency's sake.

        Parameters:
        ops - OperationList of the image to process.
        sourceInfo - Information about the source image.
        outputStream - Stream to write the image to. Implementations should not close it.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOutputFormatException
        ProcessorException

      • setSourceFormat

        void setSourceFormat(Format format)
              throws UnsupportedSourceFormatException
        Parameters:
        format - Format of the source image. Will never be Format.UNKNOWN.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedSourceFormatException
